intro: Meadia thornensis, commonly known as the Thorny Meadia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Meadia thornensis is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
